com.jmex.physics.vehicle
Class Vehicle

java.lang.Object
  com.jmex.physics.vehicle.Vehicle
Direct Known Subclasses:
Car
public abstract class Vehicle
extends java.lang.Object

A Vehicle contains a chassis with wheels. It also contains parameters for engine power and suspention. Its max speed is by default enginePower/100.

You control its movement by using its steering wheel and gas pedal.

Derived classes will need to define how gas and steering should be handled. They will also need to initialise the Hinge2Joints that connect the wheels to the chassis.

TODO: Let the user better handle the Vehicle as a whole. E.g. when user moves or rotates the chassis, the wheels and anchor points should follow.

Author:
Per Thulin
See Also:
Hinge2Joint, Car

Constructor Detail

Vehicle

public Vehicle(DynamicPhysicsObject chassis,
               DynamicPhysicsObject[] wheels,
               float enginePower,
               float suspention)
Creates a new Vehicle with the given chassis and wheels.

Parameters:
chassis - The DynamicPhysicsObject that makes out the chassis of the vehicle.
wheels - The wheels of the vehicle. Each wheel is connected to the chassis via an Hinge2Joint
enginePower - The power of the engine. A heavy vehicle needs a powerful engine.
suspention - A lower value stiffens the suspention.
Method Detail

setSteeringWheel

public abstract void setSteeringWheel(float percent)
Sets how many percents of the maximum angle the steering wheel is rotated in. A value of 1 means that it's fully rotated to the right, and a value of -1 means that it's fully rotated to the left.

Parameters:
percent - A value that can range from -1 to 1.
See Also:
addToSteeringWheel(float), setSteeringWheelMax(float)

setGasPedal

public abstract void setGasPedal(float percent)
Sets how hard the gas pedal is being stepped on (e.g. how many percent of the maximum speed that is being targetted). A value of 1 means that it's fully down, and a value of -1 means that it's in full reverse (hehe yeah I know, that doesn't make much sense). And well, yes, you guessed right: a value of 0 means that it isn't pressed at all.

Parameters:
percent - A value that can range from -1 to 1.
See Also:
addToGasPedal(float), setMaxSpeed(float)

addToSteeringWheel

public abstract void addToSteeringWheel(float percent)
Adds a given amount of rotation to the steering wheel

Parameters:
percent - The percent to add.

addToGasPedal

public abstract void addToGasPedal(float percent)
Presses a given amount on the gas pedal.

Parameters:
percent - The percent to add.

detachWheel

public void detachWheel(int wheelNr)
Detatches a given wheel from the car chassis. Could be useful for damage simulation and such.

Parameters:
wheelNr - The wheel number. E.g. 0 means the front left wheel.

getWheels

public DynamicPhysicsObject[] getWheels()
Gets the wheels of this vehicle.

getGasPedal

public float getGasPedal()
Gets the amount of gas that is being applied. A value of 1 means that the gas pedal is fully down, and a value of -1 means that we are in full reverse.

Returns:
The amount of gas that is being applied.

getSteeringWheel

public float getSteeringWheel()
Gets the position of the steering wheel. A value of 1 means that it's fully rotated to the right, and a value of -1 means it's fully rotated to the left.

Returns:
The position of the steering wheel.

setSuspention

public void setSuspention(float suspention)
Sets the suspention of this Vehicle. A smaller value stiffens it.

Parameters:
suspention - The suspention to set.

Returns thesuspention of this Vehicle.

setMaxSpeed

public void setMaxSpeed(float maxSpeed)
Sets the maximum speed of this vehicle. By default it's enginePower/100.

Parameters:
maxSpeed - The maxSpeed to set.

getMaxSpeed

public float getMaxSpeed()
Gets the maximum speed of this vehicle. By default it's enginePower/100.

Returns:
Returns the maxSpeed.

setSteeringWheelMax

public void setSteeringWheelMax(float steeringWheelMax)
Sets the maximum angle that the steering wheel can be turned in.

Parameters:
steeringWheelMax - The steeringWheelMax to set (in radians).

Gets the maximum angle that the steering wheel can be turned in.
